content: I have 14 days to loose ten lbs HELP me please...What do I do??? how do i do this what do i do to fix this?

content: buy some epsome salts... put two tablespoons in large glass of water... drink. stay close to the bathroom and when its time you should shed at least 5-7 lbs...... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
reply: buy some epsome salts... put two tablespoons in large glass of water... drink. stay close to the bathroom and when its time you should shed at least 5-7 lbs...... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
title: 14 days

content: Take 6 gallons of water and place them in your largest closet. Get one 5 gallon pale and place in same closet. Set your answering machine to answer all incoming calls so you are not disturbed. Step inside closet and close door behind you. Now don't come out for the next 14 days. Simple! Know what the 5 gallon pale is for?

content: Make an appt to see your doctor NOW, so that you can get the right advice from a health professional. No offense m551 and TsgtTharin. When it comes to weight loss, losing 10# in 2 weeks is not healthy. One should only lose between 1 - 2 pounds/week. And to the OP, the faster you lose the weight, the faster you'll gain it back. 'Cause remember, once you lose it, you'll have to keep it off. And when did you find out about needing to lose the 10 pounds? The reason I'm asking is I'd be surprised that the Navy would tell you at the last minute about having to lose the extra weight. Again, there is a Right and Healthy Way to lose the weight, and there's the Wrong and Unhealthy Way to lose it.
reply: Make an appt to see your doctor NOW, so that you can get the right advice from a health professional. No offense m551 and TsgtTharin. title: 14 days

content: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: buy some epsome salts... put two tablespoons in large glass of water... drink. stay close to the bathroom and when its time you should shed at least 5-7 lbs...... Sea Salt would be what you really want if you are going to do this. It flushes you out in about 30-60 minutes. But, that is just your bowels. OP, just so you know, there is no way that you can lose 10 pounds of fat in that time. For the average person, if they ate absolutely no food for 14 days, they would just barely lose 9 or 10 pounds (a mixture of fat, water, muscle and feces). And, that is not feasible nor is it healthy. So, you will have to lose weight other ways. You can lose roughly 3-5 pounds of fat if you lower your caloric intake to about 2000 calories a day spaced out evenly over 6 small meals. You must eat in order to lose fat, otherwise your body will go into starvation mode and retain fat rather than shed it. Plus, not eating can cause harm to your body. So, make sure each meal has a lean protein sourse, a complex carbohydrate and a veggie in it. These things take more energy to digest than many other foods, thus burning more calories. Also, incorporate 30 minutes of moderate cardio per day into your daily routine. I personally like 20 minutes of HIIT for cardio, but I am too lazy to explain HIIT to you. Sorry. Drink more water than usual for all days except for the day you weigh in. The reason I am telling you to drink more water is because your body adapts to whatever stimulus you give it. By drinking more water everyday, your body will get the hint that water is not scarce and will retain less of it. When you wake up on the day of the weigh in, your body still thinks that it will get plenty of water, so you will be about 2 lbs lighter than normal, so don't drink anymore than a glass or two on the day of the weigh in. And, most importantly, do not eat on the day of the weigh in. On the day of your weigh in, take a mustard bath. A mustard bath opens up your pores and releases the oils in your skin. This only accounts for .5-1 lb, but it is better than nothing. Try to find a mustard bath mix that does not contain any other oils in it, otherwise it will defeat the purpose. About 2 hours before you leave your house for the weigh in drink one quart of warm water mixed with two heaping teaspoons of sea salt (your stomach should be empty, remember). This will cause you to evacuate any remaining feces that is in your bowels. The weight of this will probably be less than 2 pounds, but every little bit helps. Remember, cloths can account for almost 5 lbs and shoes a pound or two. So, make sure you get weighed in your underwear. Good luck! And, make sure you get a good meal and a decent amount of water after you weigh in. P.S. How much do you weigh? What is your bodyfat percentage. Because, for most people in the 170-230 pound range, my recommendation of 2000 calories a day is perfect. But, if you weigh more than that, add 400 calories a day. If you weigh less, subtract 400 calories a day from that. And, make sure the food you eat is natural food. Proteins should be lean steak (top sirloin, top round), any fish, skinless chicken breast, fat free cottage cheese, egg whites, etc. Complex carbs should be brown rice (no white rice), 100% whole wheat bread (no white bread or that multigrain bs), potatoes, fruits (not canned), sweet potatoes, cous cous, plain oatmeal, fat free yogurt, beans, wild rice, pasta. With the veggies stick mainly to the green ones (brussels sprouts, spinach, broccoli, peas, etc) . Also, do not use condiments, butter, margerine, oils, sugars, etc. Do not eat any meats or things such as shrimp that has any breading on it. You are fine to use spices, peppers, hot sauce, etc. You can even use ketchup, but do so very sparingly. The whole point of your meals should be that they are devoid of anything unnecessary. They give you the nutrients that you need without all of the BS. Also, even though I said to do 30 minutes of cardio a day, try to stay relatively active during the rest of the day. No being a couch potato. P.S.S. If in the future you want to know how to effectively lose weight the healthy way (by losing fat and retaining muscle) and improve your overall physical condition, get back to me. So far I have only shown you how to lose a lot of weight in lbs without causing undue harm to your health. But, losing weight is different than losing fat. You are still going to look the same after this. This message has been edited. Last edited by: 10Tenths, Tue 24 March 2009 12:08 AM

content: Why do you need to loose 10 lbs in 14 day's? Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: Why do you need to loose 10 lbs in 14 day's? Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
title: 14 days

content: To do it safely , you should only lose about 2.5 lbs a week. Of course it is all a matter of taking in less calories than you burn. Of course if you want to make weight , talk to a wrestler. Remember that safety rules prohibit many of the techniques they used to use to protect the student. If my son was close to his weight he would use a "spit bottle" before weigh-ins. You would be suprised how much a half a bottle of spit weighs. Unfortunately , if you are taking a physical, your urine sample would show you are de-hydrated. That would not be good.
reply: To do it safely , you should only lose about 2.5 lbs a week. Of course it is all a matter of taking in less calories than you burn. Of course if you want to make weight , talk to a wrestler. content: quote: Originally posted by ssg91B: If the OP wants to make the weight safely, than he'll have to make an appt with his doctor. A wrestler is not a health care professional and the OP should not be talking to one. Just my .02 cents worth. Nutrition, weight loss and physical fitness are not the specialties of most doctors. That is like going to a electrician to get your plumbing fixed. Sure, they work in the construction industry, but it isn't their particular specialty. If you want real advice, go to a registered dietitian, a kinesiologist or a Human Performance Physical Fitness Specialist. One of the worst things you could do for nutritional or training advice is go to a doctor. You go to a doctor to make sure that you are healthy enough to begin a fitness or diet program, but that is about it. Doctors simply do not have the specialized training to give advice in those fields. If you would rather save some money there are plenty of books out their by highly accredited people that you can learn the same thing that the above listed specialists will tell you. This stuff isn't rocket science.
